text: Dobbins Air Reserve Base or Dobbins ARB is a United States Air Force reserve air base in Marietta, Georgia. It is about northwest of Atlanta. It was originally known as Dobbins Air Force Base. It was named in honor of Captain Charles M. Dobbins, a World War II C-47 pilot who died near Sicily. ==References== Category:Military buildings and structures in the United States
title: Dobbins Air Reserve Base
